body_html:
Thanks for looking into this. I now run into a different error. Not sure if the other error masked this one or if this is a completely different issue (let me know if I should file this separately):

$ bazel build --config=cuda --verbose_failures --spawn_strategy=standalone -c opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package 
WARNING: Output base '/system/user/unterthi/.cache/bazel/_bazel_unterthi/dd424fe506e42444112be8dec7db846b' is on NFS. This may lead to surprising failures and undetermined behavior.
........
WARNING: Sandboxed execution is not supported on your system and thus hermeticity of actions cannot be guaranteed. See http://bazel.io/docs/bazel-user-manual.html#sandboxing for more information. You can turn off this warning via --ignore_unsupported_sandboxing.
INFO: Found 1 target...
ERROR: /data01/bioinf/tom/apps/tensorflow/tensorflow/python/BUILD:247:1: Converting to Python 3: tensorflow/python/ops/functional_ops.py failed: 2to3 failed: error executing command 
  (cd /system/user/unterthi/.cache/bazel/_bazel_unterthi/dd424fe506e42444112be8dec7db846b/tensorflow && \
  exec env - \
  bazel-out/host/bin/tools/python/2to3 --no-diffs --nobackups --write --output-dir bazel-out/local_linux-py3-opt/genfiles/python3/tensorflow/python/ops --write-unchanged-files tensorflow/python/ops/functional_ops.py): com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell.BadExitStatusException: Process exited with status 1: 2to3 failed: error executing command 
  (cd /system/user/unterthi/.cache/bazel/_bazel_unterthi/dd424fe506e42444112be8dec7db846b/tensorflow && \
  exec env - \
  bazel-out/host/bin/tools/python/2to3 --no-diffs --nobackups --write --output-dir bazel-out/local_linux-py3-opt/genfiles/python3/tensorflow/python/ops --write-unchanged-files tensorflow/python/ops/functional_ops.py): com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell.BadExitStatusException: Process exited with status 1.
Target //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package failed to build
INFO: Elapsed time: 87.057s, Critical Path: 11.50s

For what it's worth, I'm trying to use Python 3.5.1 (custom build, not the system installation). What I find really puzzling is the file bazel is trying to execute (2to3):

$ cat /system/user/unterthi/.cache/bazel/_bazel_unterthi/dd424fe506e42444112be8dec7db846b/tensorflow/bazel-out/host/bin/tools/python/2to3
#!/bin/bash

exit 1

I changed this file to exit 0 instead, but this again leaves me with an error:

$ bazel build --config=cuda --verbose_failures --spawn_strategy=standalone -c opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package 
WARNING: Output base '/system/user/unterthi/.cache/bazel/_bazel_unterthi/dd424fe506e42444112be8dec7db846b' is on NFS. This may lead to surprising failures and undetermined behavior.
WARNING: Sandboxed execution is not supported on your system and thus hermeticity of actions cannot be guaranteed. See http://bazel.io/docs/bazel-user-manual.html#sandboxing for more information. You can turn off this warning via --ignore_unsupported_sandboxing.
INFO: Found 1 target...
ERROR: /data01/bioinf/tom/apps/tensorflow/third_party/gpus/cuda/BUILD:122:1: declared output 'third_party/gpus/cuda/lib64/libcufft.so.7.5' was not created by genrule. This is probably because the genrule actually didn't create this output, or because the output was a directory and the genrule was run remotely (note that only the contents of declared file outputs are copied from genrules run remotely).
ERROR: /data01/bioinf/tom/apps/tensorflow/third_party/gpus/cuda/BUILD:122:1: not all outputs were created.
ERROR: /data01/bioinf/tom/apps/tensorflow/tensorflow/python/BUILD:247:1: output 'python3/tensorflow/python/ops/functional_ops.py' was not created.
ERROR: /data01/bioinf/tom/apps/tensorflow/tensorflow/python/BUILD:247:1: not all outputs were created.
Target //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package failed to build
INFO: Elapsed time: 3.169s, Critical Path: 1.73s

(In case you're wondering: I changed all references of CUDA libraries to 7.5, since installing 7.0 on this system is not an option. libcufft.so.7.5 is in a path that is included in LD_LIBRARY_PATH)

body:
Thanks for looking into this. I now run into a different error. Not sure if the other error masked this one or if this is a completely different issue (let me know if I should file this separately):

```
$ bazel build --config=cuda --verbose_failures --spawn_strategy=standalone -c opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package 
WARNING: Output base '/system/user/unterthi/.cache/bazel/_bazel_unterthi/dd424fe506e42444112be8dec7db846b' is on NFS. This may lead to surprising failures and undetermined behavior.
........
WARNING: Sandboxed execution is not supported on your system and thus hermeticity of actions cannot be guaranteed. See http://bazel.io/docs/bazel-user-manual.html#sandboxing for more information. You can turn off this warning via --ignore_unsupported_sandboxing.
INFO: Found 1 target...
ERROR: /data01/bioinf/tom/apps/tensorflow/tensorflow/python/BUILD:247:1: Converting to Python 3: tensorflow/python/ops/functional_ops.py failed: 2to3 failed: error executing command 
  (cd /system/user/unterthi/.cache/bazel/_bazel_unterthi/dd424fe506e42444112be8dec7db846b/tensorflow && \
  exec env - \
  bazel-out/host/bin/tools/python/2to3 --no-diffs --nobackups --write --output-dir bazel-out/local_linux-py3-opt/genfiles/python3/tensorflow/python/ops --write-unchanged-files tensorflow/python/ops/functional_ops.py): com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell.BadExitStatusException: Process exited with status 1: 2to3 failed: error executing command 
  (cd /system/user/unterthi/.cache/bazel/_bazel_unterthi/dd424fe506e42444112be8dec7db846b/tensorflow && \
  exec env - \
  bazel-out/host/bin/tools/python/2to3 --no-diffs --nobackups --write --output-dir bazel-out/local_linux-py3-opt/genfiles/python3/tensorflow/python/ops --write-unchanged-files tensorflow/python/ops/functional_ops.py): com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell.BadExitStatusException: Process exited with status 1.
Target //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package failed to build
INFO: Elapsed time: 87.057s, Critical Path: 11.50s
```

For what it's worth, I'm trying to use Python 3.5.1 (custom build, not the system installation). What I find really puzzling is the file bazel is trying to execute (`2to3`):

```
$ cat /system/user/unterthi/.cache/bazel/_bazel_unterthi/dd424fe506e42444112be8dec7db846b/tensorflow/bazel-out/host/bin/tools/python/2to3
#!/bin/bash

exit 1
```

I changed this file to `exit 0` instead, but this again leaves me with an error:

```
$ bazel build --config=cuda --verbose_failures --spawn_strategy=standalone -c opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package 
WARNING: Output base '/system/user/unterthi/.cache/bazel/_bazel_unterthi/dd424fe506e42444112be8dec7db846b' is on NFS. This may lead to surprising failures and undetermined behavior.
WARNING: Sandboxed execution is not supported on your system and thus hermeticity of actions cannot be guaranteed. See http://bazel.io/docs/bazel-user-manual.html#sandboxing for more information. You can turn off this warning via --ignore_unsupported_sandboxing.
INFO: Found 1 target...
ERROR: /data01/bioinf/tom/apps/tensorflow/third_party/gpus/cuda/BUILD:122:1: declared output 'third_party/gpus/cuda/lib64/libcufft.so.7.5' was not created by genrule. This is probably because the genrule actually didn't create this output, or because the output was a directory and the genrule was run remotely (note that only the contents of declared file outputs are copied from genrules run remotely).
ERROR: /data01/bioinf/tom/apps/tensorflow/third_party/gpus/cuda/BUILD:122:1: not all outputs were created.
ERROR: /data01/bioinf/tom/apps/tensorflow/tensorflow/python/BUILD:247:1: output 'python3/tensorflow/python/ops/functional_ops.py' was not created.
ERROR: /data01/bioinf/tom/apps/tensorflow/tensorflow/python/BUILD:247:1: not all outputs were created.
Target //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package failed to build
INFO: Elapsed time: 3.169s, Critical Path: 1.73s
```

(In case you're wondering: I changed all references of CUDA libraries to 7.5, since installing 7.0 on this system is not an option. `libcufft.so.7.5` is in a path that is included in LD_LIBRARY_PATH)
